title: Japanese e-book cultural/historical pack
description:
I tried to get a wide variety of viewpoints, interesting publications, and texts from Japan to give a nice varietal perspective on a plethora of Japanese related topics and even some minority interests: Some of these items are out of print, and rather hard to find. I hope you enjoy.

All files are .epub, unless marked.

Included in this torrent:

* The short stories/ political writings of Yukio Mishima (1925-1970)

* A Hundred Verses from Old Japan: Being a translation of the Hyaku-nin Isshiu - Fujiwara Sadaie (1909)

* Contemporary Japan: History, Politics, and Social Change since the 1980s - Jeff Kingston (2010)

* Yokohama Yankee: My Family's Five Generations as Outsiders in Japan - Leslie Helm (2013)

* Emperor of Japan: Meiji and His World, 1852-1912 - Donald Keene (2005) 

* Forbidden Asia - Hans Jurgen-Dopp (2012) [.PDF]

* Grounds of Judgment: Extraterritoriality and Imperial Power in Nineteenth-Century China and Japan - PÃ¤r Kristoffer Cassel (2012)

* Hirohito and the Making of Modern Japan - Herbert P. Bix (2001)

* The History and Culture of Japanese Food - Naomichi Ishige (2011)

* Japan Journeys: Famous Woodblock Prints of Cultural Sights in Japan - Andreas Marks (2015)

* Japanese Fairy Tales - Yei Theodora Ozaki (2015)

* Japanese Political History Since the Meiji Renovation 1868-2000 - Richard Sims (2001)

*Yoshimasa and the Silver Pavilion: The Creation of the Soul of Japan - Donald Keene (2013)

*Japanese Proverbs: Wit and Wisdom (200 Classic Japanese Sayings and Expressions) - David Galef and Jun Hashimoto (2012)

*Justice Pal's Dissenting Opinion on the rulings of the International Military Tribunal for the Far East, (1945)

* Kwaidan: Stories and Studies of Strange Things - Lafcadio Hearn (1904)

* Seven Japanese Tales - Junichiro Tanizaki (1996)

* The Company and the Shogun: The Dutch Encounter with Tokugawa Japan - Adam Clulow (2013)

* The Nobility of Failure: Tragic Heroes in the History of Japan - Ivan Morris (2013)

* Toyotomi Hideyoshi: The background, strategies, tactics and battlefield experiences of the greatest commanders of history - Stephen Turnbull (2010) [.PDF]


Remember: Keep Seeding!
